column4: Okay, this is interesting. Before installing Storage Device Manager, I could use the fdisk -l and vol_id commands. After installing SDM and configuring two volumes, both fdisk and vol_id return the error: Cannot open /dev/sda. Running Intrepid.
just a thought on that,  check if the owner or group changed for the device
Thanks for the tip. "sudo fdisk -l" returns the info. I think SDM took over my drive. :)
yes it probably changed the group for the device   you can  ls -l /dev/sda    and add the group to your user account
i personally don't like the idea of users being able to access raw devices tho,  it's a security hole

Yep. Changed the group to "disk". Thanks, mate. Yeah, that's what I'm thinking. Whether to keep SDM or not; because the way it is right now, it's quite good that it prevents me from accidentally doing some sort of dmg.
yes they move the packages to oldreleases.ubuntu.com  i think that's the spelling anyway
Is dbus running? ps auxww | grep dbus
Hmm. Maybe check whether you have the dbus packages as listed on http://ubuntuforums.org/archive/index.php/t-146868.html?
I'm not 100% sure this will fix epiphany, but I think it's worth a shot.
libdbus-1-cil was the only one that i didn't already have
